net.java.html.plotlyjs

Class Plotly<T extends Charts>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.java.html.plotlyjs.Plotly<T>

  • public final class Plotly<T extends Charts>
extends Object

    Plotly for Dukescript

    A Dukescript-based Java wrapper for Plotly.js.

    Typical Usage

    In order to construct a basic chart, the prototype is generally as follows:
    1. in your view, include Plotly.js and create a container for your plot as outlined here.
    2. Put the data to be plotted in a List.
    3. Construct one or more Traces with the specified data.
    4. Build one or more Charts with the trace type as the parameter.
    5. Construct a PlotlyData object with the Chart< <some Trace> > as the type parameter.
    6. Call newPlot(String,PlotlyData,Layout), or newPlot(String,PlotlyData,Layout,Config) for advanced options
    7. Enjoy the magic of Plotly.

    Example

    //constructing a simple sine graph in a div called "myScatter" with 480x400px dimensions...
    List scatter0x = new ArrayList<>();
    List scatter0y = new ArrayList<>();
    for(double t = 0;t<4*Math.PI;t+=0.1){
    scatter0x.add(t);
    scatter0y.add(Math.sin(t));
    }
    CartesianTrace scatterTrace0 = new CartesianTrace(scatter0x,scatter0y);
    Scatter scatter0 = Scatter.builder().trace(scatterTrace0).build();
    PlotlyData> scatterData = new PlotlyData<>(scatter0);
    Plotly> scatter = Plotly. newPlot("myScatter", scatterData, new Layout.Builder()
    .title("Scatter with Click Event")
    .width(480)
    .height(400)
    .build());
    Author:
    daykin <daykin at frib msu edu>

      • newPlot

        public static <CHART extends Charts> Plotly<CHART> newPlot(String id,
                                                           PlotlyData<CHART> data,
                                                           Layout layout,
                                                           Config config)
                                                    throws PlotlyException
        Type Parameters:
        CHART - a type of Chart, i.e. any type which extends Charts.
        Parameters:
        id - the the DOM element id in your view which will contain your plot.
        data - a PlotlyData object representing
        layout - A Layout object.
        config - Advanced Plotly configuration options in a Config object. the average Joe will probably not need this.
        Returns:
        a Plotly object representing this plot.
        Throws:
        PlotlyException
